data.title: #5567: Replacing System.Drawing for DesktopGL
Constant Buffer overrun on DesktopGL
data.body:
When using a shader under DesktopGL we get the following exception 

```Offset and length were out of bounds for the array or count is greater than the number of elements from index to the end of the source collection.```

The error occurs at [1].

For this shader the offset is 64 the length of the _buffer is 112 bit the size of the data is 4*4*4. Which override the end of the buffer.  the sample shader is over at [2].

@tomspilman @Jjagg any idea which the shade compiler is not creating a buffer of the correct length?

[1] https://github.com/MonoGame/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Graphics/Shader/ConstantBuffer.cs#L87
[2] https://github.com/infinitespace-studios/RacingGame/blob/master/Content/Shaders/PreScreenSkyCubeMapping.fx

data.title: Remove forgotten touches
data.body:
Quickfix for a problem I encontered. Sometimes old touch events weren't removed and got stuck indefinitely. This crude fix removes orphaned touches that weren't updated for at least two frames.

I was testing on windows with EnableMouseTouchPoint & EnableMouseGestures.

data.title: OpenGl 3.1 not creating graphic device.
data.body:
I am using the current developer monogame api. I got a customer that has openg 3.1 and isn't able to run the game. Error resolve around the user doesn't have opengl 3.0 or higher.

Does the current developer api require opengl greater than 3.0 or am I wrong and monogame uses a higher opengl version higher than 3.1?

The user has an intel HD graphics 3000 laptop pc.

ERROR log:

data.title: Maximize Windows
data.body:
In my 'game' I want to have a maximized window, that is not full-screen.  SDL supports this with `SDL_MaximizeWindow` however the `Sdl` class is `internal` so my Game doesn't have access to it.

So I threaded the function call through GameWindow like this:
https://github.com/robert-wallis/MonoGame/commit/b8e4e06ee34f344bc18c3ec1437f11522ff24dae#diff-c36ddd5c033ea9ae2a05b30e38dfc0a6R159
By adding a new public Maximize(), Minimize() and Restore() function to GameWindow, SDLGameWindow, and the appropriate function pointers inside Sdl.Window.

* Is this something for which I should create a PR? (but finish it up by adding the functionality to the other desktop platforms) 
* Or would it be better to mark `Sdl` as `public` so my Game code can call it directly.

I also have another issue with Windows where a stylus doesn't register as down for a half second.  Which is infuriating. But can be turned off if you have the HWND through some special Win32 API magic.  
* So I had to add the `SDL_GetWindowWMInfo` function pointer, and then add a new HWND property since GameWindow.Handle and SDLGameWindow._handle point to the SDL_Window and not the HWND.  https://github.com/MonoGame/MonoGame/compare/develop...robert-wallis:HWND?expand=0
* Or if I made `Sdl` `public` then I wouldn't have to create the new property.

What kind of PR would you rather see?  I'm new to MonoGame so I'm not sure if it's better to abstract everything and thread functionality through the main classes, or provide a set of public APIs that you can optionally access if you want.

data.title: [W10] CoreApplication project template & fixes
data.body:
(requires fix #5613)

Related to #5915

data.title: Texture2D mipmap generation and population fixes
data.body:
- Mipmaps are now generated correctly down to 1x1 in the content pipeline.
- Mipmaps are generated in the content pipeline in one location before it gets to the TextureProfile, avoiding duplication of functionality.
- Mipmaps are generated before compression, not during.
- Texture2D.OpenGL construction no longer generates mipmaps, but allocates mipmaps for population by SetData.
- Added more texture processing tests for non-square, power-of-two and non-square, non-power-of-two textures with mipmaps.
- Added Texture2D PlatformSetData overload for optimization of setting of an entire mip level.

Not tested on Android or iOS yet as I'm having Xamarin license issues.

data.title: Revert "added event handing when window nor active to allow runtime to suspend app"
data.body:
~~This reverts commit   ##76661cf~~.

fix for #5612

data.title: [W10/CoreApplication] Game loop doesn't run.
data.body:
Probably the bug surface due to the new way of event processing on StoreApps but the root of the problem I believe it to be #2084. The app stays forever in IsActive=false and the game loop doesn't run. 

That's a break from XNA behavior.
Update/Draw should always be called and it's up to the game dev to check Game.IsActive and skip physics , pause the game or whatever.

I suppose we should revert #2084. If there are issues with Suspend and Store certification those should be handled independently of lost of focus & minimize.

data.title: Remove reference to SharpDX from project templates
data.body: A MonoGame project don't need to reference SharpDX directly.

data.title: Don't throw an error if a channel exists already, just return it.
data.body:
While porting a game I came across a problem where the XNA pipeline
would quite happily process a model. In the MG pipeline the following
error was thrown.

	System.ArgumentException: Vertex channel with name Tangent0 already exists

I figure rather than throwing an error we should just return the
existing channel.

data.title: Fix up some weird Effects crashes.
data.body:
One of the samples I am porting hit this issue where the
EffectParameter.SetValue (int) for Single/Int parameters
as well as for Scalar and Vector parameters.

There was also a problem with access the Element[i] array in
EffectParameter.SetValue(Single[]). In this case it was crashing
event though the Data object was correct. This commit
removes the use of Element in favour of Data which other Setters
use.

data.title: [SDL] Use existing variable for pointing to SDL in OpenGL.SDL.cs
Use GetTypeInfo code on all platforms
data.body: GetTypeInfo code works on all platforms... so there really is no reason not to use it on all platforms.

data.title: Implement Joystick IsGamepad property
data.body: http://community.monogame.net/t/how-to-detect-if-a-joystick-is-a-gamepad/8914

data.title: Fix or remove `checkedRect` from Texture2D Set/GetData
data.body:
The `checkedRect` change in Texture2D Set/GetData is broken for compressed texture formats:

https://github.com/MonoGame/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Graphics/Texture2D.cs#L149

It doesn't consider that for compressed formats there is a minimum mipmap size that must be enforced.  So it passes the incorrect rectangle down to methods for setting the texture data.

IMO we sure purge this  `checkedRect` business entirely from the code base.

In particular the removal of calling SetData with a `null` rectangle is likely a performance hit.

I am willing to bet that for example `GL.TexSubImage2D` is slower than `GL.TexImage2D` when setting texture data.  Same with the methods under DirectX when the full texture level was being set instead of a sub-rectangle of the texture surface.

IMO we need to refactor all this to restore the old behavior for `null` rectangles and fix the checking when a rectangle is passed to consider compression needs.
